By submitting to your fervor you make yourself vulnerable but gain an edge on your opponents.

When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to gain an expertise die on melee weapon attack rolls until the start of your next turn. When you do so, until the start of your next turn attack rolls against you gain an expertise die.

table.name: Combat Maneuvers
rows: Gain advantage against a nearby creature.
Attack an adjacent creature which tries to cast a spell.
Focusing on your in depth training with certain weaponry gives you proficiency with all weapons.
Use an enemy's armor against them, paralyzing them.
Roll away from an opponent who misses you.
Both you and an adjacent ally gain +2 AC.
Attack in a shifting flow of deft strikes that make it easy to blind enemies.
Deprive your opponents of any ability to see, whether with their eyes or otherwise.
Briefly see without the use of sight and use a reaction to chase down a fleeing enemy.
Unleash a powerful yell that injures and frightens your foes.
Take a hit for an ally and reduce the damage it inflicts on you.
Jump at an enemy and use your ability check as your attack roll.
Brand a foe to make it reticent to approach or attack you.
Make a melee attack against an enemy casting a spell.
Take the Help action whenever you hit with a melee weapon attack.
Use a reaction when you would be reduced to 0 hit points to heal yourself.
Move and make a melee attack.
Make an additional attack with a heavy weapon.
Shoot a missile out of the air.
Protect an ally from opportunity attack.
Paralyze your opponent with a heavy weapon.
Charge forward to strike an enemy and feed off of the adrenaline from hitting, increasing your Speed.
Cut a symbol into your target in order to frighten it.
Score critical hits on a roll of 19–20 for one round.
Make an attack that critically hits and possibly even incapacitates your opponent.
Gain an expertise die on Deception and Sleight of Hand checks in combat.
Make a spellcaster miss you with its spell attack.
Ignoring other enemies allows you to strike one foe more accurately.
Knock your enemy's weapon or shield from their grasp.
Your enemy drops their weapon when they miss you.
Learn the health and defenses of opponents you damage.
Your attacks are critical hits on rolls of 19–20 and they end spells.
Dart up to an opponent casting a spell and strike them, possibly disrupting the magic.
Use your reaction to take cover behind a creature or object when a ranged attack misses you.
Fire two missiles and do extra damage.
You and an ally knock a creature prone.
A nearby ally can push a creature as a bonus action.
You and up to 3 allies can disengage and move their Speed.
Dash a container of liquid over a nearby foe.
Push your foe 10 feet on a hit.
You and an ally restrain a creature.
Gain an AC bonus when you are hit.
Increase your AC as long as you move at full Speed.
Trip a creature which misses you.
Blind your enemy with a well-aimed strike.
Reroll a saving throw when charmed, frightened, poisoned, or stunned.
Increase the range of your missiles.
Use a Sleight of Hand check as your attack bonus.
React to danger with unnatural swiftness.
Make melee attacks against all enemies who miss you.
Ignore difficult terrain and be better able to resist being immobilized.
Attack a creature and ally has attacked to knock it prone.
Trick a creature into not attacking anyone but you.
Make a frenetic series of attacks until one of your strikes misses.
Force a creature to attack you.
{@optfeature Guarded Draw|LUA5E:AG} {@homebrew {@note This feature does not appear in the text.}}
Use a ranged weapon without disadvantage when adjacent to an enemy and make ranged opportunity attacks against those who move away from you.
Strike your enemy and cause fatigue.
Concentrate on what you can hear to see what cannot be seen and deftly evade attacks.
Focusing on your training with a weapon, you make your attacks more devastating and ignore an enemy's defenses.
Aim for and exploit a foe's weak spot with a dangerous shot.
Gain an expertise die on Athletics checks and saving throws against combat maneuvers, and reduce difficult terrain.
Use a reaction to retain concentration when you would otherwise lose it.
Gain additional reactions for this round.
Use a ranged weapon to attack to shoot a creature from as far away as you can see.
Throw a smaller ally at a creature within 20 feet.
Quickly draw a melee weapon and attack a creature.
Use a reaction to make a melee attack.
Get advantage to resist being charmed or frightened.
Knock your target prone when you hit with a melee attack.
Deal extra damage and knock your target prone with a lance.
Leap from your mount to score a critical hit against an enemy.
Use your reaction to throw an enemy who misses you.
Knock your target prone when you hit with a melee attack.
Move up to 40 feet and either push or knock your target prone.
An ally can attack a foe you hit with a critical hit.
Turn your weapon attacks into distractions that allow allies to move through the battlefield more freely.
Focus on making every hit with a natural weapon, unarmed strike, or dual-wielding weapon have a satisfying impact.
Attack a group of creatures within 10 feet of a focal point.
Use a reaction to turn a strike that misses into an attack against a different opponent.
Move your mount's Speed and gain advantage on your first attack.
Make a Sleight of Hand check against a creature you have hit.
Give nearly any weapon the {@itemProperty T||thrown} property.
Knock your target off-balance, reducing its Speed and agility.
Use your reaction to make a Sleight of Hand check against a target which hits you.
Increase your AC against one creature and gain a free attack if it misses you.
Exhaust your exertion pool to transform all of your attacks into combat maneuvers.
Focus on making your strikes as devastating as possible, increasing how often you score a critical hit.
Cause your enemy to suffer disadvantage while you focus all your attacks on them.
Use your reaction to make a Sleight of Hand check.
Move next to an enemy about to use an item and take it from their hands.
Use a bonus action to make ranged weapon attacks in melee without disadvantage.
Move 20 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
Strike targets who normally require magic.
Attack a creature which grapples you.
Use a reaction and spur your mount to jump impossible distances.
Make a melee attack against an enemy casting a spell.
Use your reaction to draw a weapon and make a ranged attack when initiative is rolled.
Do extra damage when making multiple attacks.
On a hit, hit the target again with disadvantage.
Use a reaction to inspire an ally to fight onward when they take a hit.
Quickly consume or administer a potion.
Make an additional attack against a creature you have hit.
Trip your foe as an opportunity attack.
Frighten nearby foes from atop your mount.
Encourage your mount and restore some of its hit points.
Redirect an attack to strike an adjacent creature.
Use a reaction to turn an attacker's strike back upon them.
Use a reaction to respond to a weapon attack with a strike of your own that disrupts a foe's offensive.
Ignore your target's cover with a ranged attack.
Increase the size of your mount's jump.
Move and make a melee attack.
Make your mount the target of an attack.
On a hit, make your target confused, prone, or slowed.
Use a reaction when attacked to evade it by relying on your Perception, gaining an edge on your attacker with a successful dodge.
Adjacent allies with shields gain +2 AC.
Shove a creature 10 feet when it attacks an ally.
Use your reaction to avoid being frightened, poisoned, or stunned.
Make a quick attack against a large foe or a foe which attacks you with a heavy weapon.
Disrupt an enemy's spellcasting and fray the magic to disorient them as well.
Use a reaction to evade an opponent's attack and swap places with your attacker, stunning them.
As long as your mount can see you with but a whistle it rushes to your side.
Grant advantage to your mount's ability checks and saving throws.
Be bigger than you really are.
Make a quick strike against a foe that moves within your reach and arrest their movement.
Fight with and alongside your mount, altering your assault to make it deadlier and harder to hurt.
Move up to 15 feet though hostile spaces.
Focus on weak spots to deal more critical hits that inflict more damage.
Stun your target with a successful attack.
Snatch your foe's weapon away when they miss you.
Give your weapon the rebounding and thrown properties.
Use a reaction when hit with an attack to possibly turn it into a miss.
Move and knock those in your path prone.
Perform an impressive trick with a ranged weapon attack.
Flow past your enemies and deliver a strike against each of them.
Use a reaction to turn a roll of 18 or more into a critical hit.
Fall upon an enemy in concert with your allies and make their attacks more effective with every blow struck.
Make your target unable to cast spells or use combat maneuvers.
Prevent yourself from being paralyzed, petrified, or stunned.
Heal yourself when reduced to 0 hit points.
Get a free attack against a foe who scores a critical hit against you.
Grant allies advantage on death saving throws when you score a critical hit.
Increase your AC by 2 for one round.
Stop a creature from moving away from you.
Gain an expertise die on Insight checks and increase your passive Insight score.
Caper about an enemy and rain down attacks from atop your mount, circling back with every strike.
Attack all creatures adjacent to you and deal extra damage.
Attack all creatures adjacent to you.
Move and gain a climb speed.
Turn a miss with a heavy weapon into an attack against a different target.
Make a strike so superb that the wake it cuts through the air damages an enemy beyond your reach.
Create a massive shockwave by striking the ground with a heavy weapon.
Pretend to die and then strike when an opponent makes themself vulnerable.
Cause ongoing damage to your target.
Gain expertise dice on attacks in exchange for granting expertise dice to your foes.

data.name: Chapter 9: Combat Maneuvers

items: The knight wheels his horse around and levels his lance at the great beast guarding the gates. Spurring his steed forward, he charges at the fiend, his lance aimed at its heart.
As the orc hunters approach, the ranger swiftly knocks a pair of arrows and lets them fly simultaneously, knocking the two lead attackers from their dire wolf mounts.
The duelist deftly steps aside as the clumsy brute lunges forwards. With a few swift strokes, she carves the letter 'K' into his back. Her foe will never forget her name!

entries: Combat maneuvers encompass the techniques honed by warriors devoted to learning the nuances of battle, discovered and perfected through innumerable fights and countless hours of practice. As adventurers become more skilled in the arts of combat, what they can accomplish with a seemingly simple strike grows in breadth and scope, making true masters as deadly in a duel as any archmage. Even novices make use of combat maneuvers however, and with the right timing and a bit of luck they can change the course of critical battles.

entries.name: Combat Traditions
entries: Combat traditions are the basic disciplines of fighting that a warrior relies upon: Adamant Mountain, Biting Zephyr, Mirror's Glint, Mist and Shade, Rapid Current, Razor's Edge, Sanguine Knot, Spirited Steed, Tempered Iron, Tooth and Claw, and Unending Wheel. Each also represents an ethos to combat—the traditions a warrior knows are as defining as a mage's preferred schools of magic. Although regions and cultures may have different names for combat traditions or value some more than others, the tenets at the core of each are the same and practitioners of similar styles often forge alliances through fundamental beliefs that can bridge enormous divides.

These disciplines are much more than mere styles of fighting—they embody the focuses of your training and greatest strengths as a warrior. Two warriors utilizing the same combat traditions might fight in entirely different ways with different weaponry. What they share in common are similar psychological states, approaching battle from the same mindset and concentrating on the same general objectives with their techniques.

entries.name: Maneuvers in Combat
entries: Adventurers can do much more than just hit an opponent or dodge a blow, instead delivering special attacks that debilitate or turning a foe's missed assault into a painful mistake. Many of these techniques are combat maneuvers, sublime methods and tactics that make every combatant and their approach to fighting unique.

You know a number of combat maneuvers determined by your class and class level. Your known combat maneuvers are chosen from the combat traditions you are proficient with. Whenever you learn a new maneuver, you can choose one of the maneuvers you know and replace it with another maneuver of the same level or lower.

Using a combat maneuver requires spending one or more exertion points and either a bonus action, reaction, action, or they are performed as part of the Attack action. Certain combat maneuvers require two or more attacks (from Extra Attacks or the use of other class features), and if you are unable to use the Attack action to make as many attacks on your turn as the combat maneuver requires, you cannot use that combat maneuver.
A maneuver sometimes forces a target to make a saving throw to resist its effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Combat maneuvers are nonmagical.

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: In order to learn a combat maneuver, you must know its combat tradition and meet its prerequisites. New combat maneuvers learned through a feat or by taking levels in an additional class may be up to the highest degree of combat maneuvers you are able to learn.

entries.name: Stances
entries: The complexities of each combat stance require the right state of mind, making the reordering of one's tactical view a necessary act of focus. Activating a combat stance requires a bonus action. Once activated, a combat stance remains active until you are knocked unconscious, stunned, activate a different combat stance, begin a long rest, or choose to end it on your turn.

entries.name: Exertion Pool
entries: A warrior requires willpower, whether born from discipline, survival instinct, or bloodlust, to control the ebb and flow of combat around them. Every call to act beyond a typical block or strike depletes this cool disposition.

To use a combat maneuver, you must expend exertion points. You have a maximum number of exertion points equal to double your proficiency bonus. You regain any spent exertion points at the end of a short or long rest.

Alternatively, you can meditate, refocus, and stretch to refill your exertion pool more quickly. You expend Hit Dice to do so, recovering {@dice 1d4} exertion points for each Hit Die expended. The process takes 1 minute per expended Hit Die.

entries.name: Basic Maneuvers
entries: Melee combat is not always an exchange of weapon attacks—sometimes you are trying to subdue, not kill. Other times, you may want to do something else other than damage your target in order to gain an upper hand. Several other basic maneuvers are presented below. The Narrator can use these to help adjudicate other improvised actions, following a similar structure and using similarly weighted effects.

All creatures can use basic maneuvers, even if they do not have access to combat maneuvers. No exertion points are required to use a basic maneuver. Unless otherwise noted, using a basic maneuver replaces an attack made on your turn.

entries.name: Basic Melee Damage
entries: When you successfully use a basic maneuver you also deal basic melee damage. This is equal to 1 + your Strength modifier. Basic melee damage is bludgeoning damage, but at the Narrator's discretion may be piercing or slashing damage.
You cannot use a basic maneuver to activate any features that deal additional damage (such as Sneak Attack or Divine Smite) unless the feature specifically states otherwise.
Any creature with a Challenge Rating of 0 cannot deal basic melee damage.

entries.name: Movement and Combat Maneuvers
entries: Any movement granted by a combat maneuver only affects how far you can move on your turn if it refers to your Speed.

entries.name: Adamant Mountain Maneuvers
entries: {@i Hardiness, Might, Power}

Engaging in combat means enduring some amount of suffering and those who make use of Adamant Mountain maneuvers are well prepared to weather their opponents' blows, relying not just on their might but the careful and expert application of force in all aspects of battle.

entries.name: Biting Zephyr Maneuvers
entries: {@i Distance, Sharpshooting, Thrown Weapons}

Not every battle requires making close contact with the enemy and there is an art to fighting from a distance, whether that be a few dozen feet or hundreds. Warriors that know Biting Zephyr techniques are superlative ranged combatants, not only for the deadly accuracy of their attacks but also the myriad tricks they've mastered to routinely make shots that should be impossible.

entries.name: Mirror's Glint Maneuvers
entries: {@i Flowing, Insightful, Reactive}

At its heart combat is a dance between opponents and practicing the Mirror's Glint tradition means reading, interpreting, and anticipating one's foe. Using instinct and your insight from battles won and lost, you are excellent at reacting to an enemy in order to gain the upper hand.

entries.name: Mist and Shade Maneuvers
entries: {@i Diversion, Feinting, Mental}

Making the wrong move in a fight can be fatal— particularly when an opponent causes such a misstep. Warriors that rely on Mist and Shade maneuvers are confounding foes that play mental games amidst battle, feinting and leading their enemies into crucial mistakes they are all too ready to exploit.

entries.name: Rapid Current Maneuvers
entries: {@i Fast Strikes, Mobility, Swiftness}

It is not always the hardest hits that win a fight— sometimes striking first is far more important. Embracing rapid blows and agility, warriors of the Rapid Current tradition know how to use speed to its utmost to defeat a foe.

entries.name: Razor's Edge Maneuvers
entries: {@i Awareness, Concentration, Discipline}

The most impressive strikes and superlative parries are not matters of luck or circumstance when made by a warrior utilizing the Razor's Edge—they are the fruits of keen awareness, concentration, and iron-clad discipline.

entries.name: Sanguine Knot Maneuvers
entries: {@i Legion, Teamwork, Trust}

A battle fought alone is often a battle already lost and practitioners of the Sanguine Knot tradition focus on the opportunities presented when an ally is nearby to help. While they may be weaker alone, these warriors are lethal in tandem and the trust they have for their companions make them truly valuable adventurers to keep nearby.

entries.name: Spirited Steed Maneuvers
entries: {@i Mounted, Soldiering, Warfare}

There are many warriors that fight on horseback— or an altogether different kind of creature—and master the tricks of battling in tandem with their mount to overwhelm slower, less mobile foes. The most common adherents to this tradition are soldiers typically born to noble castes with the resources to both keep steeds and pay for the tutelage of their use.

entries.name: Tempered Iron Maneuvers
entries: {@i Confidence, Conviction, Zealotry}

To achieve victory over any opponent a warrior must be confident and those who utilize the techniques of Tempered Iron are certain of their every step and swing, often zealous in their pursuit of a foe and motivated by a daunting drive to succeed no matter the cost.

entries.name: Tooth and Claw Maneuvers
entries: {@i Animalistic, Movement, Natural}

There is a fundamental need to survive that all creatures tap into during a fight, an urge to endure can be captured and focused to tremendous effect. Wielders of Tooth and Claw are animalistic in their attacks, moving around in combat and pouncing upon an opponent's every weakness.

entries.name: Unending Wheel Maneuvers
entries: {@i Mastery, Patience, Training}

There are many facets to combat—how one places their feet, an adroit grip upon a weapon's hilt, the angle of a shield arm—but achieving exceptional skill over specific weaponry can be an efficient means to victory. By patiently focusing your martial studies you unlock secrets that general practitioners of combat never glean, and with dedicated training you master their use.

data.name: Back Cover

entries: {@style Prepare for Adventure!|dnd-font;large}

In this guide to {@i Level Up}, the advanced roleplaying game, you will find everything you need to play. Create diverse and unique heroes, engage in epic combat with villainous foes, cast powerful spells, and build mighty strongholds!
This core rulebook includes:

items: A unique origin system which allows you to select your heritage, culture, background, and destiny!
Details of adventuring gear, weapons, armor, vehicles, and strongholds.
Full rules for combat and adventuring.
Hundreds of spells, combat maneuvers, exploration knacks, and other exciting abilities!
An advanced rule system which adds depth to the core 5th Edition rules while maintaining full compatibility.

entries: {@i Level Up} is a standalone game. Everything you need to create your character and start adventuring can be found in this rulebook.
